phrases.text: I am happy to be here
My name is Sarah and I am from Paris
How do you spell your name?
I do not have a pen
I live in a small town
My son is five years old
The shop is closed on Sundays
I have a meeting on Tuesday
The glass is on the table
I am looking for a job
The boat is on the water
What do you want to drink?
The cat is on the chair
The dog is under the table
The book is in the bag
The pen is next to the phone
The picture is on the wall
The bank is near the park
The car is in front of the house
The garden is behind the house
The ball is between the shoes
The lamp is above the desk
The keys are inside the box
I am looking for a shirt
Do you have a smaller size?
Do you have a larger size?
Do you have this in black?
Thank you, have a nice day
I am not hungry in the morning
Do you like pizza for dinner?
The dinner is on the table
My clothes are in the closet
I have a lamp on my desk
The cat sleeps on the sofa
They do not have a car
I do not see the problem
The bag is big, not small
The tea is hot, not cold
The man is tall, not short
The book is old, not new
The exam is easy, not hard
The street is wide, not narrow
The car is expensive, not cheap
The room is clean, not dirty
The sun is bright, not dark
The box is full, not empty
The day is good, not bad
The answer is right, not wrong
The chair is soft, not hard
There is a book on the table
There are two pens in my bag
There is a cat in the garden
Is there a milk in the fridge?
There is a car in front of the house
There are three windows in the room
Is there a bank near here?
There is a man at the door
There are many trees in the park
He doesn't have any friends here
I go to work at eight
I go to bed at ten
The plane is in the sky
The days are long in summer
The nights are long in winter
I go to the beach in summer
I wear a coat in winter
The tiger is orange and black
May I go to the bathroom?
We often go to the park
Do you always wake up early?
The cat is on the bed
The keys are in my pocket
The book is on the shelf
The phone is on the table
K, L, M, N, O, P
How do you spell your name?
I say goodbye to my family
I walk to the bus stop
I am ready for the day
In my opinion, it is good
Do you want milk or juice?
I am tired because I work hard
She stays home because it is raining
I study, so I am smart
He eats an apple and a banana
I have a car but I walk
She is happy because she has a gift
We are cold, so we wear coats
You can have tea or water
He is rich but not happy
I am here because you called me
Put the milk in the fridge
I am very well, thank you
What do you like to do?
I like to read and travel
It was nice talking to you
